snippet: For Gov. Chris Christie, the consequences of not sticking to a post-surgery diet could be dire, including having to run to the bathroom after eating the wrong food.
abstract: Estimated 200,000 people a year have weight-loss surgery in the United States, and banding procedure chosen by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, placing silicone band around the upper part of stomach to restrict intake, is the least invasive and least risky type; still, those who have undergone the surgery say it is no easy path to slimness.
lead_paragraph: For Gov. Chris Christie, the consequences of not sticking to a post-surgery diet could be dire, including having to run to the bathroom after eating the wrong food.

headline.seo: Patients Say Gastric-Band Procedure Won’t Guarantee Weight Loss
headline.main: No Easy Path to Slimness, Patients Say of Procedure
headline.print_headline: No Easy Path To Slimness, Patients Say Of Procedure
